meanings.definition: To pay someone for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The company will remunerate you for your hard work.
meanings.sent2: I will remunerate you for fixing my computer.
meanings.sent3: I hope they remunerate you well for all your help!
meanings.sent4: Her dedication was remunerated with a bonus.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to remunerate the workers fairly for their time.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant will remunerate you for your shift.
meanings.sent2: He promised to remunerate me for the extra hours.
meanings.sent3: I wonder how they will remunerate you for that mistake.
meanings.sent4: His efforts were remunerated with a promotion.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to remunerate them for their efforts.

meanings.definition: To reward or reimburse for effort.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will remunerate you for your excellent grades.
meanings.sent2: She always remunerates her employees for their dedication.
meanings.sent3: I hope they remunerate you with a big surprise!
meanings.sent4: His hard work was remunerated with a well-deserved vacation.
meanings.sent5: The company will remunerate you for going above and beyond.
